item.title: Pain is a such a strong and complex emotion that you can associate with so many things, both positive and negative. Professional cyclists have a few things to teach us on this regard.

item.title: I recommend the passage where Tyler describes how he carried on and won a stage at the Tour de France with a broken Collarbone. Regardless of doping, that was truly extraordinary. He also gave colors to different stages of pain. Few of us have experienced such a synaesthesia...

item.title:
Only additional worry I had is that ecDNA could be used to "store" resistance.
e.g. Drug A targets Gene A, but if Gene A is placed on ecDNA, it may survive elimination. Then when Drug B targets Gene B, Gene A could be reactivated from ecDNA for its beneficial use.

item.title:
Several mammal species live in cold-water environments thanks to adaptations like blubber and large size. A notable exception is the sea otter—so how does it stay warm?
A 2021 Science study found an answer: skeletal muscle thermogenesis. https://t.co/JQlYVxjGCJ https://t.co/MYuSjjWzzr
